passages.text: Equity ResearchAugust 29,2025
LB 3Q25 First Look: (N) Beal Buoyed by Reserve Releases

Similar to the Big 6, LB garnered a Q3 beat that was underscored by better-than-expected provisions, along with stronger top-line growth aided by the longer quarter, absorbing flattish lending, margin compression, and higher expenses. With the headline beat, we anticipate some strength in the stock's valuation today; however, with Q3 results buoyed by releases in performing loans, offsetting higher impaired credit losses, earnings quality will be the debate.
LB reported adjusted EPS of $0.78 vs. consensus estimate of $0.72 and our more bullish forecast of $0.77 (and vs. $0.73 in Q2 and $0.88 from a year ago).
Three key takeaways from the quarter's results and why they matter:
1. Credit improves. Like the Big 6, provisions declined, falling to $11.1 million (vs. $16.7 million in Q2), as releases in Stage 1 & 2 absorbed higher impaired credit losses.
2. Net interest income turns positive. Aided by the longer Q3 and steady loan volumes offsetting margin pressures, NII rebounded from Q2 and was above levels from a year ago.
3. Non-interest revenue stabilizes, adjusted expenses trend higher. NIR climbed from Q2, buoyed by stronger brokerage fees, but the longer Q3 and performance-based compensation weighed on costs.
Parsing through the results, we highlight the following key performances in the quarter:

**Net** **interest** **income:** Despite margins pressures, buoyed by the longer quarter and stable lending,net interest income strengthened, up 2.0% to $185.8 million (vs. $182.2 million last quarter) and above the $180.8 million a year ago.

**Loans and deposits:** Following negative loan growth last quarter, lending volumes were stable on both sequential and annual basis. The sequential loan performance was highlighted by increases in residential mortgage loans (+1%), offsetting weaker personal loans (-1%), while commercial lending was flat. Deposits rose 1.9% from last quarter and 4.2% from a year ago.The stronger sequential growth was aided by a rebound in business deposits (+3%), while personal deposits (+2%) trended higher for a third straight quarter.

Margins: After holding steady in Q2, net interest margins ebbed to 1.82% (vs. 1.85% last quarter) but above the 1.79% from a year ago. Management highlights the margin performance reflected seasonally lower inventory financing volumes.

Non-interest **revenues:** After two straight quarters of declines, adjusted non-interest revenues turned positive, rising 1% from Q2 but down 20% from a year ago. Parsing through the NIR results,the stronger Q3 was driven by higher fees and securities brokerage commissions (+15% Q/Q).
Non-interest **expenses:** With the longer Q3, adjusted NIX edged up 2% sequentially but down 1%from a year ago, weighed by the longer quarter, as well as higher salaries and benefits (+5% Q/Q).

FLASH NOTERATINGHOLDPRICEC$31.68*PRICE TARGET|% TO PTC$31.00|-2%52W HIGH-LOWC$31.74-C$24.37FLOAT (%)|ADV MM (USD)99.3%|4.82MARKET CAPC$1.4B|$1.0BTICKERLB CN*Prior trading day's closing price unless otherwisenoted.
**John Aiken, CFA * | Equity Analyst**

Credit: Overall, provisions for credit losses were \(11.1 million vs. our forecast of\) 17.4 million (and \(16.7 million in Q2- 25), while impaired PCLs came in at\) 19.7 million vs. our estimate of \(13.9 million and\) 14.4 million last quarter. The lower total credit loss was buoyed by recoveries of \(8.5 million in Stage 1 & 2 vs. performing loan credit losses of\) 2.3 million last quarter. As a result, on a relative basis, total PCL ratio eased, down 7 bps to \(0.12\%\) (vs. \(0.19\%\) in Q2- 25 and \(0.18\%\) from a year ago).

Capital: Common Equity Tier 1 capital ratio came in at \(11.3\%\) vs. \(11.0\%\) last quarter and up from \(10.9\%\) from a year ago. In conjunction with the quarter, LB held its quarterly dividend per share steady at \(0.47\) (unchanged since Q3- 23), in line with our expectation.
LB will hold its earnings conference call at 9:00am. Dial- in details: 1- 800- 990- 4777.
Laurentian is a regional bank based in Quebec, providing personal banking services to retail clients, and commercial banking and capital markets services for small- and medium- sized businesses.
Our price target of C\$31 for LB is based on a 9.5x forward P/E against FY26E EPS of \$3.25.
Risks to our investment thesis and valuation include:

- After a strategic review in the fall of 2023 failed to find a buyer, the aftermath of a new executive management team, including CEO and heads of personal banking and commercial banking, results in an extended timeline of a turnaround.- An update on a 'refreshed' strategic plan marks the second strategic revamp in less than three years, and the proof will be in the execution.- On the macro front, a weaker-than-expected recession weighs on credit to a greater degree, as PCL ratios above the bank's (and our) expectations of high teens. While a more depressed economic slowdown weighs on credit, lending volumes, and non-interest revenue lines, including banking activity and market-related revenues, also face added downside pressure.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise PicksJefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
- Laurentian Bank of Canada (LB CN: C\$31.68, HOLD)

**Notes:** Each box in the Rating and Price Target History chart above represents actions over the past three years in which an analyst initiated on a company, made a change to a rating or price target of a company or discontinued coverage of a company.
I: Initiating Coverage
